content.prompt_es: Complete each sentence with the correct perfect modal verb.
content.main_text: She ___ (not/attend) the meeting; I didn't see her there.
content.explanation:
(1) Usamos 'must not have' para indicar una conclusión lógica sobre algo que no ocurrió.
(2) Utilizamos 'should have' para expresar una expectativa que no se cumplió.
(3) Aquí, 'could have' indica una posibilidad que no se realizó.
(4) 'Should have told' indica que era correcto o recomendable informar.
(5) Usamos 'must have finished' para suponer que algo tuvo que ocurrir.

content.prompt_es: Complete the sentences with the correct words.
content.main_text: In this lecture, the professor discusses the impact of technology on education. The main points are (1)___, the importance of (2)___, and the future of (3)___ in classrooms. Additionally, the professor emphasizes the need for (4)___ skills to adapt to these changes. Students are encouraged to (5)___ their own research to support their understanding.
content.explanation:
(1) La palabra que falta es 'technology', que se refiere a la influencia de la tecnología en la educación.
(2) La palabra que falta es 'collaboration', que destaca cómo trabajar juntos es esencial en la educación moderna.
(3) La palabra que falta es 'learning', que se refiere a cómo el aprendizaje está cambiando con la tecnología.
(4) La palabra que falta es 'digital', que sugiere que se necesitan habilidades en el ámbito digital para navegar en el mundo moderno.
(5) La palabra que falta es 'conduct', que sugiere que los estudiantes deben realizar su propia investigación.

content.prompt_es: Read the following passage carefully and answer the questions that follow.
content.explanation: El pasaje enfatiza que para tener éxito en el ambiente empresarial competitivo actual, es esencial entender argumentos complejos.
content.stimulus_en:
In today's competitive business environment, understanding complex arguments is vital for success. Many companies face challenges when trying to adapt to rapid changes in consumer behavior and technology. An effective approach to this problem involves analyzing market trends and employing strategic thinking. Companies must understand not only their own strengths and weaknesses but also those of their competitors. This knowledge allows businesses to position themselves advantageously in the market. Furthermore, clear communication of these analyses to stakeholders is crucial for aligning interests and driving the business forward. As a result, leaders who can articulate complex arguments effectively are often more successful in securing buy-in for their initiatives, ultimately leading to better business outcomes.

What is a vital skill for success in today's business environment?
